Function Documentation

int __cvmx_pko3_dq_param_setup ( unsigned  node  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Initialize the pointer to the descriptor queue parameter table. The table is one named block per node, and may be shared between applications.

static struct global_resource_tag __cvmx_pko_get_queues_resource_tag ( int  node,
enum cvmx_pko3_level_e  queue_level

int cvmx_pko_alloc_global_resource ( struct global_resource_tag  tag,
int  base_queue,
int  owner,
int  num_queues,
int  max_num_queues 
)

Allocate or reserve a pko resource - called by wrapper functions.

Parameters:
tag processed global resource tag
base_queue if specified the queue to reserve
owner to be specified for resource
num_queues to allocate
max_num_queues for global resource
int cvmx_pko_alloc_queues ( int  node,
int  level,
int  owner,
int  base_queue,
int  num_queues 
)

Allocate or reserve PKO queues - wrapper for cvmx_pko_alloc_global_resource.

Parameters:
node on which to allocate/reserve PKO queues
level of PKO queue
owner of reserved/allocated resources
base_queue to start reservation/allocatation
num_queues number of queues to be allocated
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on failure
int cvmx_pko_free_queues ( int  node,
int  level,
int  owner 
)

Free an allocated/reserved PKO queues for a certain level and owner.

Parameters:
node on which to allocate/reserve PKO queues
level of PKO queue
owner of reserved/allocated resources
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on failure

{
    [CVMX_PKO_PORT_QUEUES] = 16,

    [CVMX_PKO_L3_QUEUES] = 256,
    [CVMX_PKO_L4_QUEUES] = 0,
    [CVMX_PKO_L5_QUEUES] = 0,
    [CVMX_PKO_DESCR_QUEUES] = 256
}

Initial value:
 
{
    [CVMX_PKO_PORT_QUEUES] = 32,
    [CVMX_PKO_L2_QUEUES] = 512,
    [CVMX_PKO_L3_QUEUES] = 512,
    [CVMX_PKO_L4_QUEUES] = 1024,
